Intercepted RSA-encrypted plans were protected using a modulus formed from two Blum primes. Can you exploit their mistake to recover the secret message? Ciphertext: 4556894794916644481326383807502469528961686478743970238245373853802005685221063112660058071871185664073588133779348311662793450118923184098853065533561400

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6563281031059026384840767725285850551637836845351485089352309054176553148578368001473278996941202419893462226367810939311053500428299046819815270580119789, e=1146600280887309111451619062339192172471328111341410313261082413534266712240345492511350779492138562781306733630963826303848189132789618061109409745472319
The lower 104 bits of p are: 75469599748154236542240304127248793015


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{kn1m00qw}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4556894794916644481326383807502469528961686478743970238245373853802005685221063112660058071871185664073588133779348311662793450118923184098853065533561400
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6563281031059026384840767725285850551637836845351485089352309054176553148578368001473278996941202419893462226367810939311053500428299046819815270580119789, e=1146600280887309111451619062339192172471328111341410313261082413534266712240345492511350779492138562781306733630963826303848189132789618061109409745472319
The lower 104 bits of p are: 75469599748154236542240304127248793015

extra_info: p=79632082698821794687258425976768074956750449738704020400714771118423744282039, q=82420059963547005626242372650371070402476361642900123846463448302135248752251, Ï†(n)=6563281031059026384840767725285850551637836845351485089352309054176553148578205949330616628140888919094835087222451712499671896284051868600394711587085500
